title: Metadata challenge
description: トランザクションのメタデータを活用して、実世界の問題を解決するにはどうすればいいのか？

f6_assessments.q0:
Using metadata to solve real world problems is key to meeting the Cardano mission to enable, empower, facilitate and accelerate progress in the blockchain space. 
I strongly agree his challenge is critical to achieve Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1:
The metadata challenge existed in Fund 5. There were 5 proposals successfully funded for $47,200 out of $50,000. In Fund 6 there are 30 proposals in the assessment phase for the $100K fund therefore the community has the capacity and in the interest in funding this challenge up to the $200K of this challenge.
I strongly agree that the Catalyst community has the capacity to address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2:
The success criteria are fine but are not measured in the key metrics.  "Potential amount of users" is not a measurable metric. Community feedback might be an acceptable metric but it should be in the form of a survey question like "will this prototype solve a real life problem". You could add to the survey a question like "how many users do you think this prototype bring onto Cardano".  While not an ideal metric, at least they are actual measurements.
I neither agree nor disagree that success criteria and suggested metrics are set correctly to measure progress in addressing the challenge.

importance: トランザクションのメタデータがあれば、Cardanoはイベントや文書の小さな証明を保存するネットワークとして活用できます。
success: 現実の問題を解決するためにメタデータを利用するプロトタイプが構築される。プロトタイプはあらゆるTHでCatalystコミュニティに発表されます。
